name: Research and Records
section_name: Learn about Australia research and records.Vault
summary: Explorations

content.text:
1. Get Started: Learn about Australian research in this FamilySearch Wiki article.

    ☆ FS—Wiki: Australia Research

  2. Here are a few guides to getting started with Australian research.

    ☆ LT—Getting Started With Australian Genealogy: What You Need To Know
    ☆ LT—The Basics of Australian Research

  3. Watch this video for ideas on finding resources for your research.

    ☆ BYU—Discovering Your Ancestors in Australia—49:13 - 2021



  4. Resources: Explore the ☆ MyAncestors site for Australian genealogy resources.
  5. Search for ☆ Australian surnames in a number of databases.
  6. Town of Origin: Learn how to find the town of origin for your Australian ancestor.

    ☆ FS—Wiki: Australia Finding Town of Origin

  7. Books We Own: Explore the ☆ Books We Own site for books that can be checked out or researched for you by others.
Records
  1. Record Finder: Use the Australian Record Finder for research opportunities.

    ☆ FS—Wiki: Australia Record Finder

  2. Forebears.io: Explore the ☆ Forebears.io site for research records. 
  3. Ancestry: Learn how to find Australian records in this Ancestry article.

    ☆ AC—Finding Records in Australia

choices.name: Learn about research in libraries and archives.

hidden.content:
• * Good: Using the articles and videos in this Choice, write down key learnings for research strategies. Then use the learnings for searches for an ancestor.
  • * Proficient: Same as above, for two or more ancestors.

content.text:
1. Learn about archives and libraries in Australia.

    ☆ FS—Wiki: Australia Archives and Libraries
    ☆ RT—Digging Deeper into Australian Archives—23:10 - 2021



  2. Explore the ☆ Society of Australian Genealogists site for archive records.
  3. National Archives: Explore the ☆ National Archives of Australia site for a wide variety of genealogy resources.
  4. National Library: Explore the ☆ National Library of Australia site.
  5. Archives Guide: Read this guide to Australian archives.

    ☆ LT—Legacy Tree Onsite: A Genealogist's Guide to Australian Archives

  6. Directories, etc.: Learn about directories, almanacs, and gazetteers for Australian research.

    ☆ SLQ—Directories, Almanacs, and Gazetteers - 2019

  7. Surnames: Search the ☆ Geneanet site for Australian surnames.

choices.name: Explore resources for Australian cemetery records.

content.text:
1. Explore the ☆ Australian Cemeteries website to search cemetery records across Australia.
  2. Explore the ☆ Interment.net website to search Australian cemetery records.
  3. Search the ☆ Australia Cemeteries Index for cemetery records of rural Australians.
  4. Search the ☆ Find A Grave site for cemetery records.
  5. Search the ☆ BillionGraves site for cemetery records.
  6. Facebook: Visit the ☆ Australia Cemeteries Facebook page.

choices.name: Explore Australian newspapers for ancestor research.

content.text:
1. Find links to ☆ Australian newspapers on the Wikipedia site.
  2. Search Australian newspapers in the ☆ onlinenewspapers.com site.
  3. Search Australian newspapers in the ☆ newspapers.com site.
  4. Explore links to Australian newspaper sites in the ☆ Pacific section of the FamilySearch Digital Historical Newspapers page.

choices.name: Use genealogy links in the FamilySearch Wiki and other websites.

content.text:
1. In the FamilySearch Wiki, focus on these links:
    • Biographical Database of Australia
    • National Library of Australia
    • RootsChat Australian Resources
  2. Explore links in ☆ Cyndi's List.
  3. Explore links in ☆ GenealogyLinks.net.
  4. Explore links in ☆ FamilyTreeOz.com.

choices.name: Use QUIKLinks, Partners, and GenealogyInTime to quickly search the most common record collections for Australia.

name: Get Help
section_name: Get help for your Australian research.

choices.name: Use Facebook pages to get answers to your questions.

content.text:
1. Access the ☆ Australian Genealogy Group on Facebook.
  2. Access the ☆ Genealogy in Australia Group on Facebook.
  3. Visit the ☆ Asia, Africa, Pacific Genealogy Research Community on Facebook.
  4. Visit the ☆ Australia DNA Matching Facebook page.
  5. Visit the ☆ Australian Historic Photographers for Genealogical Research Facebook page.
  6. Visit the ☆ Genealogy My Ancestors Came to Australia Facebook page.
  7. See the Genealogy on Facebook list of Facebook groups dedicated to helping with research for Australia.

choices.name: Join a mailing list, community, or message board for Australian research.

content.text:
1. Explore the ☆FamilySearch community for Australian research.
  2. Join the RootsChat forum.
  3. Explore the ☆ Australian research mailing lists on Cyndi's List.
  4. Use the ☆ Ancestry message board to read or post questions about Australian ancestors.
  5. Explore the ☆ FamilySearch Community to read or post questions about Australian ancestors.
  6. Explore Australia research questions in the ☆ Genealogy Stack Exchange.

1. Learn about Australia genealogy societies in these articles.

    ☆ FS—Wiki: Australia Societies
    ☆ Family History Societies

  2. Learn about the Australian Society of Genealogists.

    ☆ Researching Family History at the Australian Society of Genealogists—8:39

  4. Get help at a family history center in Australia.
